Act of 1934 (&#167;240.12b-2 of this chapter).</span></div><div style="line-height:110%;text-align:left;font-size:8pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:8pt;">&#160;</span></div><div MS;font-size:8pt;">&#9744;</span></ix:nonNumeric></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:8pt;"> </span></div><div style="line-height:110%;text-align:left;font-size:8pt;"><span style="font-family:Wingdings;font-size:8pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:110%;text-align:left;font-size:8pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:8pt;">If an emerging growth company, indicate by check mark if the registrant has elected not to use the extended transition period for complying with any new or revised financial accounting standards provided pursuant to Section&#160;13(a)&#160;of the Exchange Act. </span><span style="font-family:Arial Unicode MS;font-size:8pt;">&#9744;</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:8pt;">&#160;</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;-sec-extract:summary;font-size:10pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Item 2.02. Results of Operations and Financial Condition</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">On </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">April&#160;30, 2020</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, Comcast Corporation (&#8220;Comcast&#8221;) issued a press release reporting the results of its operations for the three months ended </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">March&#160;31, 2020</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. The press release is attached hereto as Exhibit 99.1. Exhibit 99.2 sets forth the reasons Comcast believes that presentation of the non-GAAP financial measures contained in the press release provides useful information to investors regarding Comcast's results of operations and financial condition. To the extent material, Exhibit 99.2 also discloses the additional purposes, if any, for which Comcast's management uses these non-GAAP financial measures.&#160; A reconciliation of these non-GAAP financial measures with the most directly comparable GAAP financial measures is included in the press release itself.  Comcast does not intend for this Item 2.02 or Exhibit 99.1 or Exhibit 99.2 to be treated as "filed" under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, or incorporated by reference into its filings under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Item 9.01. RELEASE</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;text-align:center;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:bold;">COMCAST REPORTS </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:bold;">1st QUARTER</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:bold;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:bold;">2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:bold;">&#32;RESULTS</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;text-align:justify;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">PHILADELPHIA - </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">April&#160;30, 2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#8230;</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Comcast Corporation (NASDAQ: CMCSA) today reported results for the quarter ended </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">March&#160;31, 2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">&#8220;Society is being challenged like never before in our lifetime, and I couldn&#8217;t be prouder of our company, our employees, and our leadership team across Comcast Cable, NBCUniversal, and Sky. Now more than ever the world needs to stay connected, and we&#8217;re extremely pleased that our investments in our network continue to pay off as we are handling significant increases in traffic and meeting our customers&#8217; needs. While parts of our business have been more impacted by COVID-19 than others, we have continued to innovate. We are distributing our content in new ways, as evidenced by the recent launch of Peacock on X1 and Flex. We've also taken decisive action, having moved over 95% of our U.S. call-center employees to work from home and putting in place new procedures that have allowed more than 15,000 construction workers to safely come back to work to build our theme park in Beijing. All the divisions of our company are in constant communication, and the level of collaboration has been extraordinary. We have a strong balance sheet, terrific portfolio of assets, and a world-class management team. This is a moment in time; and when it passes, I am very confident that the decisions we are making now will enable us to emerge from this crisis as a healthy, strong company that is well positioned to continue to grow and succeed,"</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;commented Brian L. Roberts, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Comcast Corporation.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><div style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;Across Cable Communications, NBCUniversal and Sky, we have committed $500 Million to support employees during this time. All employees who can work from home, are, including over 95% of Cable Communications&#8217; call center employees, and ensuring customer-facing employees can do their job safely </font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">See More About Comcast&#8217;s Response to COVID-19 - </font><a style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;" href="#"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">https://corporate.comcast.com/covid-19</font></a></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:bold;">COVID-19 Impacts</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Our Cable Communications results, while strong in the first quarter 2020, will be negatively affected in the second quarter by the significant deterioration in domestic economic conditions in recent weeks and by the costs associated with our support of customer connectivity as the population increasingly works and learns remotely from home. &#160;NBCUniversal and Sky results also will be negatively impacted to a greater extent in the second quarter 2020. As a result, we expect the impacts of&#160;COVID-19&#160;to increase in significance in the second quarter 2020 and to have a material adverse impact on our consolidated results of operations over the near-to-medium term.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:bold;">Consolidated Financial Results</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Revenue</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;for the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">first</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">0.9%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$26.6 billion</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">. </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Net Income Attributable to Comcast</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">39.6%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$2.1 billion</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">. </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Adjusted Net Income</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">6.1%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to $</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">3.3</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;billion. </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Adjusted EBITDA </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">4.9%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$8.1 billion</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Earnings per Share (EPS)</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;for the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">6.6%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font Cable Communications&#8217; capital expenditures</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;color:#ee2724;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">6.9%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$1.3 billion</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;in the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">first</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">. NBCUniversal&#8217;s capital expenditures decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">16.7%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$377 million</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">. </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$197</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;million. </font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:bold;">Cable Communications Capital Expenditures</font></div></td><td colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:right;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:bold;">$1,269</font></div></td><td colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:right;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:bold;">$1,363</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;"><div style="text-align:right;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:bold;">(6.9</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-right:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:bold;">%)</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:12px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-style:italic;">Percent of Cable Communications Revenue</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;"><div style="text-align:right;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-style:italic;">8.5</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-right:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-style:italic;">%</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;"><div style="text-align:right;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-style:italic;">9.5</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-right:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-style:italic;">%</font></div></td><td colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:6px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:6px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:6px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:6px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:6px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:6px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Revenue</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;for Cable Communications increased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">4.5%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$14.9 billion</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;in the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">first</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, driven primarily by increases in high-speed internet, business services and wireless revenue. High-speed internet revenue increased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">9.3%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, driven by an increase in the number of residential high-speed internet customers as well </font></div><div><br></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:8pt;">2</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:8pt;"><br></font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><br></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">as an increase in average rates. Business services revenue increased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">8.0%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, reflecting an increase in average rates and an increase in the number of customers receiving our services. Wireless revenue increased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">52.1%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, primarily due to an increase in the number of customer lines. Other revenue increased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">7.0%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, primarily reflecting increases in revenue from our security and automation services and from licensing our X1 and technology platforms. Video revenue was consistent with the prior year period, due to an increase in average rates, offset by a decline in the number of residential video customers. Advertising revenue was consistent with the prior year period, primarily reflecting an increase in political advertising revenue, offset by reduced advertiser spending due to COVID-19. Excluding political advertising revenue, advertising revenue decreased 4.6%. Voice revenue decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">9.2%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, due to decreases in average rates and in the number of residential voice customers.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Total Customer Relationships </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">increased by </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">371,000</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">31.9</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">million</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">in the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">first</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">. Residential customer relationships increased by </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">360,000</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;and business customer relationships increased by </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">11,000</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">. Total high-speed internet customer net additions were </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">477,000</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, total video customer net losses were </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">409,000</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;and total voice customer net losses were </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">89,000</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">. In addition, Cable Communications added </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">216,000</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;wireless lines in the quarter.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Adjusted EBITDA</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;for Cable Communications increased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">6.1%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$6.1 billion</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;in the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">first</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, reflecting higher revenue, partially offset by a </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">3.4%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;increase in operating expenses. Non-programming expenses increased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">4.5%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, primarily reflecting increases in technical and product support expenses and other operating costs, partially offset by a decrease in advertising, marketing and promotion costs. Technical and product support expenses increased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">7.0%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, primarily due to increased costs associated with our wireless phone service and additional compensation costs for certain personnel as a result of COVID-19. Other operating costs increased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">7.1%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, primarily due to an increase in the allowance for doubtful accounts as a result of COVID-19 and an increase in administrative expenses. Advertising, marketing and promotion costs decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">1.9%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, primarily due to a decrease in spending. Non-programming expenses per customer relationship increased 0.6%. Programming costs increased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">1.7%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, reflecting an increase in retransmission consent and sports programming fees, partially offset by video subscriber declines. This quarter&#8217;s Adjusted EBITDA per customer relationship increased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2.2%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, and Adjusted EBITDA margin was </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">40.7%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, compared to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">40.1%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;in the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">first</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">. Cable Communications results include a loss of </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$59 million</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;from our wireless business, compared to a loss of </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$103 million</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;in the prior year period.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div><br></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:8pt;">3</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:8pt;"><br></font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><br></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Capital Expenditures </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">for Cable Communications decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">6.9%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$1.3 billion</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;in the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">first</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">. Cable capital expenditures represented </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">8.5%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;of Cable revenue in the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">first</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;compared to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">9.5%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;in last year's </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">first</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:bold;">NBCUniversal</font></div><div style="text-align:right;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:bold;">$2,337</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;"><div style="text-align:right;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:bold;">(25.3</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-right:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:bold;">%)</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:8pt;">NM=comparison not meaningful.</font></div></td><td colspan="3" style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td colspan="3" style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td colspan="3" style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td colspan="3" style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Revenue </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">for NBCUniversal decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">7.0%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$7.7 billion</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;in the first quarter of 2020. </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Adjusted EBITDA</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">25.3%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$1.7 billion</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">. </font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Cable Networks</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Cable Networks revenue of </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$2.9 billion</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;was consistent with the prior year period, reflecting decreases in distribution revenue and advertising revenue, offset by an increase in content licensing and other revenue. Distribution revenue decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">1.5%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, reflecting a decline in subscribers, partially offset by contractual rate increases and the timing of contract renewals. Advertising revenue decreased</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;color:#ee2724;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2.2%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, reflecting audience ratings declines and reduced advertiser spending resulting from the postponement of sports events due to COVID-19, partially offset by higher pricing. Content licensing and other revenue increased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">13.0%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;due to the timing of content provided under licensing agreements. Adjusted EBITDA decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">1.2%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$1.2 billion</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;in the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">first</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, reflecting flat revenue, and flat operating expenses, as higher other operating and administrative costs were offset by lower programming and production costs. The decline in programming and production costs was primarily due to decreases in the recognition of sports programming costs as a result of the postponement of sports events due to COVID-19.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Broadcast Television</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Broadcast Television revenue increased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">8.8%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$2.7 billion</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;in the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">first</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, reflecting increases in content licensing revenue and distribution and other revenue. Content licensing revenue increased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">31.3%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;due to the timing of content provided under licensing agreements.</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;color:#ff0000;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Distribution and other revenue increased</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;color:#ff0000;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">6.9%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, due to higher retransmission consent fees. Advertising revenue was consistent with the prior year period, reflecting higher pricing and local political advertising, offset by audience ratings declines and reduced advertiser spending due to COVID-19. Adjusted EBITDA increased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">29.6%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$501 million</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;in the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">first</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, reflecting higher revenue, partially offset by an increase in operating costs and expenses. The increase in operating costs and expenses was primarily due to an increase in programming and production costs, which was partially offset by the favorable impact of adopting updated accounting guidance.  </font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Filmed Entertainment</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Filmed Entertainment revenue decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">22.5%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$1.4 billion</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;in the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">first</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, reflecting decreases in theatrical revenue, content licensing revenue, home entertainment revenue and other revenue. Theatrical revenue decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">28.8%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, reflecting a difficult comparison to the success of films in the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">first</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of 2019, including </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">How to Train Your Dragon: The Hidden World, Us </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">and </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Glass</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, partially offset by the performance of films in this year's first quarter, including </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">1917, Dolittle </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">and </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">The Invisible Man. </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Content licensing revenue </font></div><div><br></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:8pt;">4</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:8pt;"><br></font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><br></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">15.4%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, driven by the timing of when content was made available under licensing agreements, partially offset by the performance of certain 2020 releases that were made available on premium video on demand after theater closures due to COVID-19, including </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">The Invisible Man</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Emma</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">The Hunt</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">. Home entertainment revenue decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">35.8%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, reflecting the success of </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Dr. Seuss' The Grinch, Halloween</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Night School </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">in last year's first quarter, partially offset by the performance of </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">1917, Downton Abbey </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">and </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Fast &amp; Furious Presents: Hobbs &amp; Shaw </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">in this year's first quarter. Other revenue decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">20.3%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, primarily due to decreases in revenue from our live stage play and movie ticketing and entertainment businesses, which were impacted by theater and entertainment venue closures as a result of COVID-19. Adjusted EBITDA decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">70.9%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$106 million</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;in the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">first</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, reflecting lower revenue, partially offset by lower programming and production costs, as well as lower advertising, marketing and promotion costs.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Theme Parks</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Theme Parks revenue decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">31.9%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$869 million</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;in the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">first</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, primarily due to the closures of Universal Studios Japan in late February and Universal Orlando Resort and Universal Studios Hollywood in mid-March as a result of COVID-19. Adjusted EBITDA decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">84.7%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$76 million</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;in the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">first</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, reflecting lower revenue and higher operating costs. The increase in operating costs was primarily due to increases in employee-related costs and pre-opening costs associated with the Universal Beijing Resort and </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Super Nintendo World</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:pt">TM</sup></font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;in Universal Studios Japan, partially offset by lower park operation costs due to the park closures.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Headquarters, Other and Eliminations</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">NBCUniversal Headquarters, Other and Eliminations include overhead and eliminations among the NBCUniversal businesses. For the quarter ended </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">March&#160;31, 2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, NBCUniversal Headquarters, Other and Eliminations Adjusted EBITDA loss was </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$184 million</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, compared to a loss of </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$174 million</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;in the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">first</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:bold;">Sky</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;margin-left:auto;margin-right:auto;width:100%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td colspan="5"></td></tr><tr><td style="width:20%;"></td><td style="width:20%;"></td><td style="width:20%;"></td><td style="width:20%;"></td><td style="width:20%;"></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-top:1px solid #c9c9c9;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td colspan="3" style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-top:1px solid #c9c9c9;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-top:1px solid #c9c9c9;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Revenue </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">for Sky decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">5.8%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$4.5 billion</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;in the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">first</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">. Excluding the impact of currency, revenue decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">3.7%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, reflecting lower direct-to-consumer revenue, advertising revenue and content revenue. Direct-to-consumer revenue decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">1.9%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$3.7 billion</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, primarily reflecting a decrease in average revenue per customer relationship due to the impact of COVID-19, which has resulted in lower sports subscription revenues, partially offset by an increase in customer relationships over the last twelve months. Advertising revenue decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">11.6%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$513 million</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, primarily due to overall market weakness, which was worsened by COVID-19, as well as an unfavorable impact from a change in legislation related to gambling advertisements in the UK and Italy. Content revenue decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">10.5%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$325 million</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, primarily reflecting the deferral of wholesale revenue from sports programming as a result of the postponement of sports events due to COVID-19.  </font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Total Customer Relationships </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">decreased by </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">65,000</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">23.9 million</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;in the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">first</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, reflecting the postponement of sports events and the suspension of certain sales channels due to COVID-19.</font></div><div><br></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:8pt;">5</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:8pt;"><br></font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><br></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><div style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Adjusted EBITDA</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">for Sky decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">16.9%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$551 million</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;in the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">first</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">. Excluding the impact of currency, Adjusted EBITDA decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">15.3%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, reflecting lower revenue, partially offset by a decrease in operating expenses. The decrease in operating expenses was primarily due to a decrease in</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">&#32;the recognition of sports programming costs as a res</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">ult of the postponement of sports events</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">&#32;due to COVID-19.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Corporate, Other and Eliminations</font><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;width:100%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td colspan="5"></td></tr><tr><td style="width:20%;"></td><td style="width:20%;"></td><td style="width:20%;"></td><td style="width:20%;"></td><td style="width:20%;"></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-top:1px solid #c9c9c9;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td colspan="3" style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-top:1px solid #c9c9c9;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-top:1px solid #c9c9c9;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Corporate, Other and Eliminations primarily relate to corporate operations, our streaming service, Peacock, and Comcast Spectacor, as well as eliminations among Comcast's businesses. For the quarter ended </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">March&#160;31, 2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, the Corporate, Other and Eliminations Adjusted EBITDA loss was </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$244 million</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, an increase of </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$69 million</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;compared to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, primarily driven by start-up costs associated with Peacock.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;margin-left:auto;margin-right:auto;width:100%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td colspan="5"></td></tr><tr><td style="width:20%;"></td><td style="width:20%;"></td><td style="width:20%;"></td><td style="width:20%;"></td><td style="width:20%;"></td></tr><tr><td colspan="5" style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-top:1px solid #c9c9c9;"><div style="text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Notes:</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:12px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:12px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:0px;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">1</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;">We define Adjusted Net Income and Adjusted EPS as net income attributable to Comcast Corporation and diluted earnings per common share attributable to Comcast Corporation shareholders, respectively, adjusted to exclude the effects of the amortization of acquisition-related intangible assets, investments that investors may want to evaluate separately (such as based on fair value) and the impact of certain events, gains, losses or other charges that affect period-over-period comparisons. See Table 5 for reconciliations of non-GAAP financial measures.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:12px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:12px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:0px;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;">We define Adjusted EBITDA as net income attributable to Comcast Corporation before net income (loss) attributable to noncontrolling interests and redeemable subsidiary preferred stock, income tax expense, investment and other income (loss), net, interest expense, depreciation and amortization expense, and other operating gains and losses (such as impairment charges related to fixed and intangible assets and gains or losses on the sale of long-lived assets), if any. From time to time, we may exclude from Adjusted EBITDA the impact of certain events, gains, losses or other charges (such as significant legal settlements) that affect the period-to-period comparability of our operating performance. See Table 4 for reconciliation of non-GAAP financial measure.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:12px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:12px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:0px;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">3</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;">All earnings per share amounts are presented on a diluted basis.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:12px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:0px;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">4</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;">We define Free Cash Flow as net cash provided by operating activities (as stated in our Consolidated Statement of Cash Flows) reduced by capital expenditures and cash paid for intangible assets. From time to time, we may exclude from Free Cash Flow the impact of certain cash receipts or payments (such as significant legal settlements) that affect period-to-period comparability. Cash payments for acquisitions and construction of real estate properties and the construction of Universal Beijing Resort are presented separately in our Consolidated Statement of Cash Flows and are therefore excluded from capital expenditures for Free Cash Flow. See Table 4 for reconciliation of non-GAAP financial measure.</font></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;padding-left:12px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:12px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:0px;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">5</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;">Sky constant currency growth rates are calculated by comparing the current period results to the comparative period results in the prior year adjusted to reflect the average exchange rates from the current year period rather than the actual exchange rates in effect during the respective prior year periods. See Table 6 for reconciliation of Sky's constant currency growth. </font></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;padding-left:12px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:12px;text-align:justify;padding-left:12px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">All percentages are calculated on whole numbers. Minor differences may exist due to rounding.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:8px;text-align:center;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Conference Call and Other Information</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">Comcast Corporation will host a conference call with the financial community today, </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">April&#160;30, 2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">&#32;at 8:30 a.m. Eastern Time (ET).&#160;The conference call and related materials will be broadcast live and posted on its Investor Relations website at </font><a style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;" href="#"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">www.cmcsa.com</font></a><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">. Those parties interested in participating via telephone should dial (800) 263-8495 with the conference ID number 9334849.  A replay of the call will be available starting at 12:00 p.m. ET on </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">April&#160;30, 2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">, on the Investor Relations website or by telephone. To access the telephone replay, which will be available until Thursday, May&#160;7, 2020 at midnight ET, please dial (855) 859-2056 and enter the conference ID number 9334849. </font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">From time to time, we post information that may be of interest to investors on our website at </font><a style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;" href="#"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">www.cmcsa.com</font></a><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">&#32;and on our corporate website, </font><a style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;" href="#"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">www.comcastcorporation.com</font></a><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">. To automatically receive Comcast financial news by email, please visit </font><a style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;" href="#"><font style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;margin-left:auto;margin-right:auto;width:100%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td colspan="5"></td></tr><tr><td style="width:23%;"></td><td style="width:26%;"></td><td style="width:6%;"></td><td style="width:22%;"></td><td style="width:23%;"></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Caution Concerning Forward-Looking Statements</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font
